Package cookbook

Class Recipe

java.lang.Object
cookbook.Recipe
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Recipe extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a recipe containing ingredients, instructions, and tags.
Author:
Stephen Schroer
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Recipe

      public Recipe()
      The default constructor for a recipe.

    • Recipe

      public Recipe(String name)
      Constructs a new Recipe object with the given name. Initializes the ingredients list, instructions, and tag list.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe

    • Recipe

      public Recipe(String name, ArrayList<String> ingredients)
      Constructs a new Recipe object with the given name and list of ingredients. Initializes the instructions and tag list.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe
      ingredients - the list of ingredients for the recipe

    • Recipe

      public Recipe(String name, ArrayList<String> ingredients, String instructions)
      Constructs a new Recipe object with the given name, list of ingredients, and instructions. Initializes the tag list.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe
      ingredients - the list of ingredients for the recipe
      instructions - the instructions for preparing the recipe

    • Recipe

      public Recipe(String name, ArrayList<String> ingredients, String instructions, String tag)
      Constructs a new Recipe object with the given name, list of ingredients, instructions, and tag. Initializes the tag list and adds the provided tag.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe
      ingredients - the list of ingredients for the recipe
      instructions - the instructions for preparing the recipe
      tag - the tag associated with the recipe

    • addTag

      public boolean addTag(String tag)
      Adds a tag to the list of meal types. Replaces spaces in the tag with underscores before adding.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag to be added.
      Returns:
      True if the tag is successfully added, false otherwise.
